entry.string: official icon
What is it?

The Blocks Module controls the configuration, display position and grouping of "blocks" on your website. Blocks provide a way to display content or functionality on your site in addition to the usual content provided by a module such as article or forum display. Blocks can be placed anywhere in your site's page displays. The Blocks module is a core module within Xaraya, and cannot be removed.
entry.translation: Das Block-Modul kontrolliert die Konfiguration, den Anzeigeort und die Gruppierung eines jeden "Blockes" auf Ihrer Website. Blöcke bieten Ihnen einen Weg zur Anzeige von Inhalt oder Funktionalität auf Ihrer Website in Ergänzung zur gewöhnlichen Darstellung, die Ihnen etwa das Beitrags- oder Foren-Modul bietet. Blöcke können überall auf Ihrer Websit platziert werden. Dieses Block-Modul ist eins der Core-Module von Xaraya und kann nicht entfernt werden.

entry.string: How to use it?
Blocks and blockgroups

You can use blocks alone, or create a containing 'blockgroup' in which to place your blocks. Xaraya has pre-configured blockgroups created at installation time. These blockgroups include right, left, center, topnav and header blockgroups. They are used in the default Xaraya theme and have blocks already assigned to them. In the case of these default blockgroups, the name reflects the position that the blockgroups have been placed in the default theme although you could rename them.

You must tell Xaraya where you want to place your blockgroups in your site page by using the 'blockgroup' tag and placing it in your template page or module template. eg <xar:blockgroup name="right" id="right" />. The default blockgroups have already been placed in the default theme template.
The Blocks module has two menu options which allow you to view and create new blockgroups.
View Groups: View the defined Block Groups.
entry.translation: Gruppen anzeigen: Zeigt die definierten Blockgruppen an.

entry.string: Add Group: Add a new block group for template positioning.
entry.translation: Gruppe hinzufügen: Fügt eine neue Blockgruppe zur Positionierung im Template hinzu.

entry.string: Creating new instances of blocks

Each module may provide the code and templates for one or more types of blocks. For example the Articles module provides a 'featured article' block, and a 'top items' block. The Base module provides a 'menu' block among others. You can create one or more instances of a block and place them in one or more blockgroups using the options provided in the Blocks module menu:
View Instances: View the current instances that are actively in use by your Xaraya System.
entry.translation: Instanzen anzeigen: Zeigt die aktuellen Instanzen, die aktiv in Ihrem Xaraya-System verwendet werden.

entry.string: Add instance: Add a new block instance to be displayed on your site.
entry.translation: Instanz hinzufügen: Fügt eine neue Blockinstanz hinzu, die auf Ihrer Website Verwendung finden soll.

entry.string: Block types are defined by a module, and installed when you install the module. You can create a new block instance from any of your installed block types using the Add instance option.

A site admin or a developer may provide a new block type after a module is installed. This new block type can be installed with an upgrade process, or alternatively if no upgrade is provided to load the block type, you can add it with the options provided by the Blocks module. You should not normally have to add a block in this manner. In addition the Block Types options allow you to view all block types that are installed and their associated module.
Add Block Type: scan a module for a new block type. This specific function is probably best left to the advanced user. Be certain to learn more about it before using it.
View Block Types: lists all the registered block types, and references which module they belong to.
Using and templating blocks and blockgroups
Each block and blockgroup container has it's own template or uses a supplied default.

The blockgroup templates (outer container templates) are kept in your theme/yourthemes/blocks directory. If there is no specific blockgroup template it will use the preloaded default blockgroup template.

The templates provided for each block come with the module that provides the block. You can override these templates if you want, and so produce your own layouts for the block content. If you do wish to create your own overrides for block templates (inner templates) then they should be placed in themes/yourtheme/modules/themodule/blocks where 'themodule' is the module providing the block.
Included Blocks
The Blocks Module has no blocks included at this time.
entry.translation: Zur Zeit enthält das Block-Modul keine Blöcke.

entry.string: Included Hooks
The Blocks Module has no hooks included at this time.
entry.translation: Momentan verfügt das Modul über keine Hooks.

entry.translation: Weitere Information über das Block-Modul kann gefunden werden bei
